# Tender Announcement of Employment Systems Review for the Senate of Canada

## Request for Proposal
**Reference:** cb-6132-54497052

**Pursuant to:** RFP SEN-007 23/24

**Publication Date:** June 5, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** July 11, 2023, at 12:00 p.m.

**Amendment No. 2**

The Senate of Canada invites bidders to submit a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of Employment Systems Review (ESR) services, as outlined in Annex “A” - Statement of Work.

**Background:**

The Senate aims to identify systemic barriers and employment obstacles faced by designated groups (women, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minorities) within the workplace. To achieve this, the Senate seeks a contractor to conduct an in-depth assessment of its workforce, review its employment systems, policies, processes, and practices, and provide recommendations to eliminate the identified obstacles.

**Key Requirements:**

Bidder must meet the minimum requirements specified in Section 3 of the RFP, which includes the selection criteria and evaluation methodology.

**Evaluation Methodology:**

The bidder shall be selected based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Tender Documents:**

The complete tender document package, including Annexes, can be accessed at [1]: [anacetto tender Link]. A downloadable version of the Bidder’s Offer Package (BOP) is available online.

**Contract Period:**

The contract duration will be determined upon award and shall not exceed the maximum period stated in the RFP.

**Submission Guidelines:**

To submit a bid, a bidder shall follow the steps outlined in Section 5 of the RFP. Late submissions will not be accepted.

**Queries and Clarifications:**

Bidder queries and clarifications must be directed to the following email: Proc-Appr@sen.parl.gc.ca no later than June 22, 2023, at 11:00 a.m. EDT.

**Note:**

Bidder must indicate the item number of the RFP to which the query relates. Also, questions marked as proprietary must be clearly identified.

The successful bidder will be required to comply with all the requirements outlined in the RFP and will be selected based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.
